fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21646].
  {panel}

Draft of a new page is irrevocable lost if the user tries to create a new page.

1. Create a new page, and don't save.
2. Enter some text in the page, and be sure a draft save is triggered.
3. Open another window tab.
4. Attempt to add a new page.
5. You are presented with the warning that you have a draft in progress.
    A new page you were adding on Jan 17, 2011 09:55 called 'testing draft' was not saved. Do you want to resume editing or discard it?
6. I don't want to resume editing OR discard it. So I click the "Cancel" button next to the "Save" button.
7. Attempt to add a new page again.
8. The draft warning is not displayed.
9. Go to "Drafts" in personal menu
10. Draft is not there. Draft is gone.

The issue results in data loss for the user. The expectation is that clicking the "Cancel" button will exit the "Add Page" function, and nothing else will change. My draft should still be there. Attempting to add a page should again present me with the draft warning. My draft should not be discarded.
fields.summary: Draft is lost when attempting to create a new page, then cancelling the new page creation

fields.description:
h5. Steps to reproduce issue
# Integrate Confluence with LDAP
# Ensure a local user and an LDAP user have {{Subscribed to daily updates}}
# Stop Confluence server
# Remove the LDAP user straight in LDAP server
# Start Confluence
# The daily report will fail with the following error:
{code}

        at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate$16.doInHibernate(HibernateTemplate.java:650)
        at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.execute(HibernateTemplate.java:370)

h5. Findings
In Confluence 2.10.3 and 3.3.1, this does not take place because of the following:
{code}
2011-01-17 18:19:16,804 WARN [DefaultQuartzScheduler_Worker-6] [atlassian.confluence.mail.ChangeDigestNotificationBean] getAllChangeReports User Test not found for notification com.atlassian.confluence.mail.notification.Notification@110002 (removing notification)
{code}

h3. Workaround for 3.4.x
# Unzip [^CONF-21645-fix.zip] into WEB-INF
# Make sure the following exists in your Confluence installation directory
#* {{confluence-install/confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/mail/ChangeDigestNotificationBean.class}}
# Restart Confluence

h1. Cause
The license entered in the setup license screen is in v1 format. The code is trying to determine the product version number as part of showing a URL on confluence.atlassian.com, which describes what do to to upgrade a license to v2 format. The code is failing because the object being used to read the version number (SystemInformationService) is unavailable before setup is complete, and this is causing the above stack trace.

h1. Workaround
Use a v2 format license, as described in [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+3.0.2+Upgrade+Notes#Confluence3.0.2UpgradeNotes-licenseupgrade].
fields.summary: Setup fails when entering v1 format license

fields.description:
When there are unsaved changes and I navigate away from the page editor, I am presented with a proper dialog box warning me about abandoning unsaved changes.  Good.

When I accidentally hit the cancel button (which is right next to the save button) I am not presented with a dialog box about discarding unsaved changes.  Bad. 

Note: I am aware that in the past there has been a deliberate decisions about this inconsistent behavior (see JRA-23284 or CONF-7526) where things like this: (amount of annoyance of a confirm dialog) x (number of times people cancel deliberately) > (amout of annoyance of losing an edit) x (number of times people press cancel by mistake)
are given as an argument.  

I'll restate my comment to that discussion:

Here's what any other piece of software I have ever used in the last 20 years does:

    * You make edits to a document
    * You select File > Close, which is equivalent to the cancel button being discussed here
      IF there are unsaved changes, you are asked if you would like to save them or not.
      IF there are no unsaved changes, the file closes without further question.

I am in the process of convincing about 50 reluctant co-workers to put their faith in confluence as the new way for our company to store and share information.  Everyone is busy and reluctant to learn yet another piece of software.  If they start losing data (like I just lost an hour of work) due to inconsistent and basically non standard functioning of the editor, then I am going to have a very difficult time indeed.  

If you still feel strongly about not making the change, then perhaps you can take it up with microsoft apple, and adobe to remove all of their warning dialogs when unsaved files are closed.  Then at least my colleagues won't find a good reason to shun confluence over their old ways of squirreling away word document in dark and distant places all over our internal network.  

Thanks.
fields.summary: irregular editor behavior when it comes to unsaved changes

fields.description:
When you are in the editor, depending on your own settings or the sever settings, you may see
- on the RTE tab the link make rich text default
- on the Wiki tab the link make wiki markup default

This is obviously an editor setting.
because we use a modified theme with a maximum screen width to fulfill our user base, this link
- may clutter the scree when it shows 
- worse appears below the RTE/Markup/Preview tabs but is mostly hidden by the box containing the icons (insert link...)

I could easily drop the link using a style and I will for now BUT there is no corresponding setting available to the user.
if required, I will add a link somewhere

BUT

the editor settings (see attached) obviously should have this setting. (other forgotten settings maybe ?)
the choices should be

Default editor (localize it in French/German too please)
- (empty) = confluence default (administration screen)
- Rich Text
- Wiki Markup
fields.summary: Add a setting for the preferred text editor in the user editor settings

fields.description:
Create a use-case focused guide on *how to use Confluence for technical documentation*.
* Start the guide in the November 2010 doc sprint. Collaborate with other sprinters, both Atlassians and people from outside the company, to get the first draft going.
* Refine the documents after the sprint.
* Request internal review.
* Move the resulting guide from the DOCSPRINT space into the Confluence user guide (DOC space).
* Let the sprinters know that their work is now part of the core Confluence documentation.
fields.summary: Guide to creating technical documentation on Confluence

fields.description:
We often get the following error when trying to save a page.
{quote}The following error(s) occurred:
An error occured while trying to save the requested page.{quote}

I can reproduce this problem every time if, while in the Rich text editor, I type "[" and then a link and press Enter to select that link. And then click Save.

If I look at the Wiki text and copy and paste the wiki text into notepad, all the links will show in smaller font. It almost looks like it's using a different character set but it's still in English, just smaller. If I remove all the "small characters" from notepad, repaste into the wiki text and click save it works. Otherwise I will continue to get the above error.
fields.summary: Saving Confluence Pages errors out when you save the page with Links

fields.description: The easiest way to reproduce is to open 2 Confluence windows, log out in one of them and then open the update status dialog in the other. See screenshot for result.
fields.summary: Update status dialog error message renders incorrectly when user is logged out

fields.description:
When using bracket notation in rich text mode, left '[' open up autocomplete mode.  You are unable to link to a page that does not exist without dropping entering wiki markup mode and typing the location manually.

Confirmed in https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-55991

fields.description:
Edit a page in the 'Rich Text' tab. Press '[', select 'Insert Web Link' and enter any URL/Link Text and click 'Insert'. Now attempt to save the page. This results in the following error,

{code}
The following error(s) occurred:
An error occured while trying to save the requested page.
{code}

Looking at the wiki markup, this occurs because of an erroneous <feff> entity prefixed to the link. When copied into a basic text editor (e.g. vim) it looks like,

{code}
<feff>[test|http://bbc.co.uk]
{code}

Removing this erroneous character allow the page to be saved.

This behaviour affects,
Mac 10.6.6/Chrome 8
Mac 10.6.6/Firefox 3.6
Windows XP/Firefox 3.6
Windows XP/IE8
fields.summary: '[' shortcut create invalid link markup

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Confluence Activity Stream gadget. All versions from 3.1 to 3.4.6 are affected.

XSS vulnerabilities potentially allow an attacker to embed their own JavaScript into a Confluence page. You can read more about XSS attacks at various places on the web, including these: 
* cgisecurity.com: http://www.cgisecurity.com/articles/xss-faq.shtml
* The Web Application Security Consortium: http://projects.webappsec.org/Cross-Site+Scripting

This issue is reported in our security advisory on this page:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/MgCzDQ

The page also includes detailed patch instructions.
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability in Activity Stream gadget

fields.description:
Just take the windows standalone version.
Create a set of favourite pages for the current user.
Turn off JavaScript (and reload)

See image

The link to remove the favourite pages are dead. (right)

Other bad links are:
- the remove this space from your favourites list (left)
- add page (top)
- add blog post (top)

My immediate concern is the favourites one at right.

As a governmental organization (and we are not the only ones), we have to support disabled users and things not working without JavaScript, especially trivial ones, are blocking issues.

Here the solution you should adopt is to do progressive enhancement everywhere.
- make your link href working without JavaScript
- use jQuery to do something more fancy if JavaScript is present

Progressive enhancement should be the default way to code.
And this is the first page that the user can see...

Current fix that I will have to implement:
- parse the output of the macro
- find the page id of each favourite page
- replace the href="#" used to remove by something working without JavaScript
- if I want the old behaviour for JavaScript, add some jQuery code to put back the links to normal
This is not fun.
fields.summary: The macro favpages used on the dashboard generates code which does not work without JavaScript to remove the page from the favourites list, this is a usability issue

fields.description:
We have identified and fixed a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Confluence \{include} macro. All versions from 2.7 to 3.4.6 are affected.

XSS vulnerabilities potentially allow an attacker to embed their own JavaScript into a Confluence page. You can read more about XSS attacks at various places on the web, including these: 
* cgisecurity.com: http://www.cgisecurity.com/articles/xss-faq.shtml
* The Web Application Security Consortium: http://projects.webappsec.org/Cross-Site+Scripting

This issue is reported in our security advisory on this page:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/MgCzDQ

The page also includes detailed patch instructions.
fields.summary: XSS vulnerability in Include Page macro

fields.description:
As a Confluence space admin I would like to provide page templates that define one or more meta data fields for pages. at page creation the user would be able to enter values for the named meta data fields (some might have the option "mandatory"). there should be a notation to display the fields at any place in the document. the fields should also be viewable/editable from the "Tools" drop-down box.

most important: if should be possible to query pages by metadata fields - comparable to JIRA JQL - have a Confluence CQL.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21601]. {panel} h5. Steps to reproduce # Go to [http://confluence.atlassian.com/dashboard.action] # Go to Feed Builder # Whether you are logged in or accessing as anonymous, the following menu is no more available: ## In Confluence 3.1 or lower, if you are logged in, the following option appears: !feed_authentication_option.png! ## If you select 'Anonymous' or you are accessing as anonymous, you should get an anonymous feed generated: !anonymous_feed.png|border=1! h5. Finding This was working fine in Confluence 3.1 or lower h5. Workaround * Remove *&os_authType=basic* from the generated feed URL or * Modify {{configurerssfeed.vm}} which is located at {{/confluence/dashboard}} by appending the following code: {code} #if ($action.hasAnonymousAccess() && !$action.isAnonymousUser())
$action.getText("label.access")
#tag( "Radio" "name='publicFeed'" "value=selectedPublicFeed" "list=accessTypes" "listKey=value" "listValue=key" "theme='notable'" "template='radiolist.vm'")
#else #if ($action.isAnonymousUser()) #else #end #end {code} just before {{#bodytag( "Submit" "theme='aui'")}}
fields.summary: Generating anonymous feed through Feed Builder is not possible anymore

fields.description:
It is impossible to add an Undefined Link from the Rich Text Editor.

By default, Autocomplete kicks in, but if you don't choose a link it suggests (which will always be the case for an undefined link), it bails and creates plain bracketed text in the editor (and the brackets are automatically escaped, so the text they envelop aren't picked up as a link).

Trying to manually enter a link without using Autocomplete results in the same problem of the editor automatically (and invisibly) escaping the brackets.

There is a workaround - edit the link in the Markup editor - but this isn't an attractive option for our non-technical user base, nor is is a effective way of adding a lot of undefined links.

This occurs in both Firefox 3.6.13 and IE 8, and was reproduced at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/TST/Test
fields.summary: Can't create Undefined Links in Rich Text Editor

fields.description:
Hi,

It would be a interessting idea if it could be possible to have a leader associated to a group.

There is the same model for project in JIRA, you can have different users able to modify the members of a project.
However, groups are still editable by the administrator only.

It would be nice to have a administration screen accessible to group leader where a user (or a list of user) could associate or disassociate people from groups.
fields.summary: Delegate group admin to specific users in confluence

# Notice that there are 2 pages in the root level (there should be 3)

This works fine in IE, but is broken as described above in Firefox and Chrome

fields.description:
Take the standalone space.
Your user creates his personal space where other confluence users have no permissions at all on the attachments. (update the permissions)
The same user create a page with attachments (any type).

Log in as the other user and go the the previous page.
Look at the attachments.
Click on the "edit" link to get access to the properties.

All the fields (see attachment screen shot) looks like editable.
Moreover if you click on save without any change you have an error message.

You cannot add or remove attachments based on permission so this screen should be read only. This is misleading for the users that we support.

fields.description:
Have space where a given user can view the pages of space and add them.
However he has no permission for attachments either as an individual user or as a confluence-user. I have explicitly removed the permissions.

have another user with attachment permissions adding a word attachment to a page. Test that editing in office is OK and that you can modify the document attachment.

Switch back to the first user and go to the same page.
There is a the link on the left to open the document in R/O, fine.
There is also a link at right to edit in office the same document.
Use it.

Now try to save, an error reported in word when he saves (see attachment with error popup from word), this is MISLEADING to show this edit in office link in the first place. Do not show it if the user has the add permission for the attachments otherwise it is doomed to fail.
The stack trace of the error on the server is in a comment below. The server does its job properly but the link should not be shown in the first place.

If you use the view link to Htmlized the office document, you also have an EDIT button which should be removed.

2011/01/12 update
I raise it from minor to major.
My testers complain, and they are totally right, that the system lets them do something which fails at the end (saving from Word).
It should not happen in the first place so show the link or the button.
I think that it is really a 30 minutes job to fix the two screens based on the permissions.
fields.summary: Attachments: The "edit in office" link or "Edit document" button should not be shown if the user has no permission to add or remove attachments in this space

# In Rich-Text Editor, insert the following

a
b
c

# Select 'c'
# Choose 'Panel' from Text Effect drop-down

The same behaviour applies to Panel, Preformatted (noformat), Quote, Code text effect.

fields.description:
A request from the support team:
Remove the page about site stats: http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Site+Statistics

It should not be there, since it depends on an unsupported plugin.

NOTES from tech writer:
* Before deleting the page, check the info for the page and fix up any links that will be broken when the page is gone:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewinfo.action?pageId=123043962
* Instead of deleting this page, change it so that it documents the Confluence Usage Stats plugin, which when enabled provides the "Global Activity" screen as well as the Space Activity tab. See http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Viewing+Space+Activity.
fields.summary: Correct the page about site statistics

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21563].
  {panel}

As like in Typo3 (see http://wiki.typo3.org/wiki/Protect_from_spam) there should be a Confluence Option to encrypt E-Mail Adresses by default.

A separate macro plugin based approach is not what users are able to use ;/ (I'm happy if they know what self made links with brackets are)
so the system has to do it itself.

This whould be a great afford to avoid spammers crawling for E-Mail adresses.

Neither I could find any other solution for that nor an other issue..just one linking to https://www.adaptavist.com/display/free/User+Management+Plugin which only protects your system from beein "infiltrated" by spammers / bots.

With kind regards,
~Marcel
fields.summary: E-Mail protection / encryption in public visible area
Admin menu items displayed to non-admins when accessing "Global Templates" page
Contradiction in the documentation - database drivers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21555].
  {panel}

It is possible to change the page title with the Confluence language Plugin, with macros that are rendered depending on which language the user configured.

However other Macros cannot access this information, like Breadcrumbs and Pagetree. All pages would have to be rendered in order to extract the changed Page titles. Confluence should provide this information for all saved pages to all macros. Either internally depending on the user language or via an interface that allows to extract the desired item.

fields.description:
The problem was potentially caused by a fault in the page hierarchy editor by a user who was using the Firefox browser. A contributing factor may have been that the user moved the pages in the hierarchy and then used the browser's Back button to go back and perform additional moves in the page hierarchy. The information in the browser's cache was stale and displayed the incorrect hierarchy after the previous move, when the user went Back. This may have caused the inconsistency to be applied to the records in the content table on further page moves.

This can cause a circular reference of parent -> child -> parent relationship.

fields.description:
Ability to restrict viewing of Blog entries at the Space level.

Potential Solutions:

option 1: Spread out the Space View among each of the different types. For example, View (Page), View (Blog), View (Comments), View (Attachments), View (Space). Move the current View to Space (View). This would allow viewing of Pages but not Blogs, or Blogs and Comments but not Pages. This offers a more granular level of View within a Space.

option 2: Allow restricting View when going to root Blog listings (viewrecentblogposts.action). This is a hack, but would solve my need for allowing viewing of pages but not Blog entries for a specific group in a Space.


Use Case: I have a separate Space for each product line. I want our business partners to see some the pages for a specific Space, but not our blog entries in that Space because we use Blog entries for posting meeting minutes. I do not want to have to create a separate Space just for meeting minutes because we place the meeting minutes in the appropriate Space based on the product the meeting is about and it is very convenient to have the Blog entries (meeting minutes, other news, etc.) in the same Space as the product line the blog entries are relevant to.
fields.summary: Ability to Restrict Viewing of Blog Entries at the Space Level

fields.description:
Create the page, "MyPage"
Add an attachment MyImage.jpg to the same page
Edit the page adding the image link manually or with the wizard !MyImage.JPG|thumbnail!
The page shows OK with the image.
Rename the attached image through the Eidt menu (2.X) or Properties (3.X)
Rename the file from MyImage.jpg to MyImage2.jpg and save.
Return to MyPage to view it and you get an error
 Unable to render embedded object: File (MyImage.jpg) not found.

Alternatively in 2.X, you have the extra menu:
Update Links? Links to this attachment from other pages will no longer work on rename/move. To prevent this, these links need to be updated. Update links?
Setting it to YES (default is NO) make no difference even if you give it some seconds after the save in case in would be a background process doing the update.

The proper behavior should be of course to look for the references to this image in all the pages and to update the pages.

NOTE: If instead of an image insertion, you do a link insertion then everything is fine, the page is properly updated so the fix should not be too complex to implement.

If the page content needs to be updated, the last modified DATE and NAME should not be updated to the current user.
This is not the current user doing the change, this is the system on behalf of the current user.
Not sure how you want to address this but if you don't you could have a user modifying pages he has not access too.
And if a watch is involved, I guess that it is better if no email should be generated for this.
Just my opinion.
fields.summary: renaming an image attachment breaks the existing image links in the pages referring to it

fields.description:
h4. Items needed:
An attachment with umlaut in the name e.g. firë_mëanëy.gif

h4. Step to reproduce:
# Attach the above file with umlaut character in the title
# Go to the attachment page. e.g. 
#* {noformat}
http://localhost:8312/download/attachments/2359297/firë_mëanëy.gif
{noformat}
#* !2010-12-23_1654.png!
# Copy it and paste to a new tab or browser
#* {noformat}
http://localhost:8312/download/attachments/2359297/fir%C3%AB_m%C3%ABan%C3%ABy.gif
{noformat}
#* !2010-12-23_1654_001.png!
# User have to log in. e.g.
#* {noformat}
http://localhost:8312/login.action?os_destination=%2Fdownload%2Fattachments%2F2359297%2Ffir%C3%AB_m%C3%ABan%C3%ABy.gif
{noformat}
#* !2010-12-23_1655.png!
# Log in to the instance and you will see page not found. e.g.
#* {noformat}
http://localhost:8312/download/attachments/2359297/fir%EB_m%EBan%EBy.gif
{noformat}
#* !2010-12-23_1655_001.png!

\\
So far I have found that if the user is already logged in, the URL will not be broken.

h4. Additional Findings:
In step 3, when you paste it to a new tab or browser, it display *ë* as *%C3%AB* which is UTF-8 (hex.)

In step 5, after user is logged in, *ë* also known as *%C3%AB* is displayed as *%EB* which is U+00EB in Unicode code point.
fields.summary: Umlaut characters get dropped after login redirection

We have identified and fixed a cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the Confluence {doc} macro.

XSS vulnerabilities potentially allow an attacker to embed their own JavaScript into a Confluence page. You can read more about XSS attacks at various places on the web, including these:
* cgisecurity.com: http://www.cgisecurity.com/articles/xss-faq.shtml
* The Web Application Security Consortium: http://projects.webappsec.org/Cross-Site+Scripting

This issue is reported in our security advisory on this page:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/HgdrDQ

fields.description:
When integrating Confluence with LDAP Server (e.g. Microsoft Active Directory 2003), and a user changes his password, the user can log in with both the old AD and new AD password. 

Steps to reproduce:

1. Log in into Confluence with some user which comes from LDAP.
2. Change the LDAP/AD password.
3. Log out of Confluence.
4. Log in into Confluence again with the new AD password.
5. Log out of Confluence.
6. Log in into Confluence, this time with old AD password.
7. Redo steps 3-6 until you are satisfied or the cache expires.

Observations:

It seems that the cache does not invalidate the old (account/user?) entry, instead, simply adds a second one. The old entry in the cache should be invalidated, so that only the new password is valid for login.

Expected behaviour:

Users should only be able to log in with the new password.
fields.summary: Users can log in with old and new password when using LDAP Integration

fields.description: The new shortcuts for headings (i.e. Ctrl-Alt-2) collide with normal key combinations on Swiss German keyboards (and probably other keyboards) in a very annoying way. E.g. the @-sign is entered on a Swiss German keyboard by pressing AltGr-2, which corresponds to Ctrl-Alt-2. So every time I want to enter an @ in the rich text editor, the current paragraph is converted to a heading 2. The only way to enter an @ at the moment is to change to the wiki markup editor.
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcuts collide with normal key combinations

h3. How to reproduce

This error can be reproduced by:

# Changing the title of a page to be invalid (e.g. by adding a leading *{{$}}*)
# Rebuilding the index using just a single reindex thread (not strictly necessary but makes following the log output easier)

{code}
UPDATE content SET title = '$ Invalid title' WHERE contentid = CONTENTID;
{code}

*This will make the content with the contentid _{{CONTENTID}}_ unusable. Do not do this in a production environment!*

Use the environment variable/system property {{-Dindex.queue.thread.count=1}} to set the number of reindex threads to 1.

Index macro should obey the excerpt macro

fields.description:
I tried adding some page permissions to a page I had open on CAC. The permissions added in the dialog but when I pressed save the button disabled (as expected) and then nothing happened. The dialog didn't close as expected, and when I pressed cancel and then reopened the dialog the changes weren't saved.

Looking at the XHR request for the save I saw that the session had timed out, but the UI shows no message about what happened.

I've previously spiked a JS Notifier object that might come in handy here.
fields.summary: Page Permissions dialog save fails without message when session timed out

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21490].
  {panel}

Popular labels macro does not allow any applied style to the background for heatmap display, this can also not be overridden in the spaces "Stylesheet" settings as the style has been applied at the element level.

I have a few solutions:

h3.Add Full Style Attributes to Macro

This is the most workable and user-friendly way to customise the macro, add following attributes to macro:

* background-color
* border
* border-color
* border-style

h3.Add background-color Attribute

Not the most ideal, but it is fairly workable, allow for transparent background-color (specify a color of ''), users can then style the border by placing the macro inside a {{panel}} macro.

h3.Move Style Attributes to Stylesheet

The least user-friendly, but it allows users to control the look of the labels macro by using their custom stylesheet for the space.

h3.Current Solution

I do have a workaround without having to modify the source for those interested. What you need to do is go to "Administration > Look and Feel > Custom HTML" and add the following to the {{HEAD}} section.

{code:html}
<script type='text/javascript' language='javascript'>
AJS.$(function($) {
  $(".heatmap ul").css("background-color", "");
});
</script>
{code}

*note*: This technique has two caveats.

# It is applied to all spaces, you can control this by testing for the spaces key.
# There will be a flicker of gray to no color when the pages first load with heatmaps in them.
fields.summary: Allow styling to popular-labels macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-21484].
  {panel}

Like the feature 
"Administration > Plugins Repository > Admin, and click on [Enter Support Mode|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Plugin+Support+Mode]"

We should also disable user macros in support mode, to test to see if they are the cause of an issue. (e.g. page not loading, performance, etc, etc). 

Class as minor as we haven't had much support requests where the user macros at fault (but this could change as user macros become more visible.
fields.summary: Disable user macros in plugin support mode
